intro: Eriophyllum obovatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf woollyblue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eriophyllum obovatum is often found in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes.
